Pure luxury in a great location
reviews.text: I have just been treated to two nights here for my birthday. We found the hotel very easily as it is very close to a metro and oly a two minute walk. The lobby was stunning and the staff throughout the stay were wonderful. I must admit I did expect breakfast to be included in this class of hotel and it was a little disappointing it wasn't considering the price of the room. The main disappointment for me was that it was €25 each extra to use the spa. My boyfriend had booked this hotel ahead of others for my birthday weekend away as we love to use a sauna after a long day of sightseeing but when we asked at reception how to get to the spa were very upset when they told us we would need to pay €50 for a sauna!!!! It just wasn't worth paying that for a quick hour spa visit, very disappointing for such a top class hotel. Other than this you can't knock the hotels staff or quality and the cocktails in the bar were also worth the money.a lovely hotel in a fantastic location.

Paris itself is so inviting, it is hard to stay indoors for long. However, when we did need to withdraw from the cold, the hotel provided a laid-back retreat. This is a hotel which doesn’t try overly hard. It’s upscale, but comfortable. Our double room was a very good size – it is Paris after all! The hotel’s art deco lobby is a gem of retro glamour with its chandeliers and plush red interiors. The Purple Bar proved to be a favourite hangout of ours, serving French wine to a soundtrack of throwback 90s hip hop music. The location was ideal, offering a great platform from which to climb to the top of the Arc de Triomphe (for those of us who cannot stomach the heights of the Eiffel Tower) and to sample the beautiful macaroons at Ladurée on the Champs-Élysées.
reviews.title: Ideal Base for the Sights and Delights of Paris

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here recently and the service was surprisingly amazing! The location is great since it's a few minutes from Champs-Élysées. The exterior and interior of the hotel is very delightful to the eye. The only real problem would be the rooms as the washroom and interior of the rooms were lacking sufficiency and quality.
reviews.title: Many improvements can be made but..

reviews.text: Otherwise, the service really does somewhat make up for the rooms. The staff speak english well and are extremely helpful and attentive. The lounge is quite nice and the restaurant is also great since the food is perfect the ambiance is quite lovely.
reviews.title: Nice location / well appointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it is an alright hotel with a great location and impeccable service but I would've expected a bit more of the rooms considering it's price and competition within Paris.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: As mentioned by other reviews the hotel is beautifully done, is in a great location and is in excellent condition. Traveling with my wife and two daughters we found the room with two double beds to suit us nicely. The hotel was formerly under the Hilton brand but in my opinion shows no signs of being operated to any reduction in standards. The staff, particularly the two different concierges that helped us, were very professional and helpful. Other reviews commented about the quality of the service and I absolutely agree. The three main issues that we experienced started with the ridiculous cost of the buffet breakfast at over $40 per person, the free Internet service was so slow it was essentially worthless and as mentioned by another review we had trouble with enough hot water, typically the shower would turn cold midway through the second person. We booked through Expedia and feel the price we paid made this hotel a good value and we will give it serious consideration on our next visit.
reviews.title: Overall very nice but still a few improvements needed...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Du Collectionneur Arc de Triomphe for two nights, we had a fantastic stay at the hotel, the entrance/lobby is very grand and beautifully decorated with fresh flowers and chandeliers.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Weekend in Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge and reception staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. We asked for nice streets with plenty of restaurants and both nights we had great evenings thanks to the suggestions made by the staff. We drank cocktails in the purple bar too which we both enjoyed, 20 euros a drink which isn't cheap but they were very tasty indeed!
reviews.title: Incredible.....

reviews.text: The room is self were very clean and like another guest has said marble sinks and surfaces which we liked maybe a little bit small but had great views of the well kept gardens and courtyard.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a quiet area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is in a lovely quiet spot and is only a 5-10 minute walk to the Champs Elysee, we could see the Arch Du Triomphe when we turned the corner from the hotel which was a nice surprise. Great hotel which we would gladly recommend.
reviews.title: ex hilton at a nice location

reviews.text: Stayed here on the executive level- champagne, fois gras, cheeses, great veiw, great service- not 1 complaint! Nicest place I ever stayed! Walking distance everywhere, great great location!! The sink was a solid piece of marble. The bathroom was incredible, our guests couldn't pick their jaws up off the floor!
